content:
Career Development Service https://www2.le.ac.uk daily 1 2006-02-14T08:00:00Z International Women\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Day 2015 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Sunday 8th March https://www2.le.ac.uk/offices/careers-new/news/international-women2019s-day-2015-2013-sunday-8th-march The University will be holding a week-long series of events to celebrate International Women\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Day (IWD) 2015. IWD was first established in 1911 and seeks to celebrate the achievements of women while calling for greater equality. For a full list of activities organised by the University, take a look here.

Your Career Development Service is committed to supporting the development of women undergraduates. Last year we ran the Sprint programme with RBS and Enterprise Rent-A-Car, which aimed to help women undergraduates take hold of their personal development and achieve their ambitions. We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre planning to run Sprint again this year \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd If you would like to register your interest early, and receive updates about the programme, then please enter your details here.

Here\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds what some students had to say last year:

It was all incredibly useful and enjoyable, I would recommend it to everyone and wish that more women had taken part in the programme.

Working in groups and discussing personal experience is the most enjoyable aspect of the programme. When we share experiences, we learn about other people's values and goals, which broaden our horizons and become less judgmental towards other people.

Emily, Sarah and guest speakers were highly inspirational and encouraging \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd it was nice to hear their experiences. Also enjoyed working in home groups and the sprint booklet is a great resource.
]]> No publisher mm475 home page News 2015-03-06T12:34:42Z News Item Looking to work on your confidence? https://www2.le.ac.uk/offices/careers-new/news/looking-to-work-on-your-confidence Come along to a two\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdsession workshop, taking place on Monday 16th and 23rd March (3:00-4:30pm), designed to help you develop the skills and confidence to effectively manage your career and life beyond university Run in partnership with the Career Development Service and Becky Talbott, Mental Wellbeing Adviser, this workshop will help you to increase your confidence and develop practical strategies for confident, professional behaviour to support your transition to employment. The workshop will run over two sessions and will involve a mixture of group activities and individual reflection.

What are the benefits?
\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdLearn techniques to feel more confident which could improve your performance at interview.
\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdHelp you feel more confident in networking/talking to employers and managing your career.
\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDevelop a personal action plan for a confident future.

*Second session takes place on Monday 23rd March, 3:00pm-4:30pm

How do I sign up?
Book your place on\ufffd\ufffdMyCareers
]]> No publisher mm475 News home page 2015-03-02T13:23:44Z News Item Success for University of Leicester students https://www2.le.ac.uk/offices/careers-new/news/success-for-university-of-leicester-students Award-winning University of Leicester students demonstrate their employability to EU experts Two University of Leicester students have won the second edition of the EU Careers Challenge that took place in Brussels on Friday, 13th February and was attended by a number of distinguished speakers, including David Bearfield, Director of the European Personnel Selection Office.

The EU Careers Challenge competition was first developed by the University of Leicester in 2013 in close partnership with the European Personnel Selection Office and since then has grown to include seven countries and 10 European universities with future plans aiming to expand it to all EU member states.

The University of Leicester\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Career Development Service is being increasingly recognised for its innovative approach to developing the employability of its students, with the EU Careers Challenge being one of many opportunities offered to students to help them develop their experience and skills. The Career Development Service was nominated for Outstanding Student Support in last year\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Times Higher Education Awards, and Leicester\ufffd\ufffdis now the 25th most targeted university by Times 100 Graduate Employers.

For more information about this story please see the full press release: http://www2.le.ac.uk/news/blog/2015-archive-1/february/award-winning-students-demonstrate-their-employability-to-eu-experts

]]> No publisher wf22 News homepage home page 2015-02-27T12:07:30Z News Item Interested in a Career in Accountancy and Finance? https://www2.le.ac.uk/offices/careers-new/news/interested-in-a-career-in-accountancy-and-finance Calling all first and second years who are considering a career in the Professional Services\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre delighted to say that the University in partnership with Pricewaterhouse Coopers LLP, Grant Thornton LLP and the ICAEW are running an Insight into Accountancy and Business Advisory Event.

This event will provide you with the opportunity to hear about the remaining Summer placements they have for this year and also for 2016. With more than 33% of employers retaining previous interns for their graduate schemes, the importance of getting work experience is becoming more and more important.

This event will be a fantastic opportunity to fully understand the sector, you will learn how to develop the necessary skills and commercial awareness ahead of applications. \ufffd\ufffdIt will provide you with the necessary hints and tips that will help you to stand out from the crowd.

The event will be taking place on Wednesday 11th March between 14:00 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 17:00.

To book a place, fill in a quick application here.

The application will ask a few questions, based on research and what you are hoping to get out of the event, please note it will only take a short amount of time.

Applications close on midnight of the 22nd February

]]> No publisher wf22 News homepage home page 2015-02-16T17:30:00Z News Item
